info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 18 at 6:43PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY LAKE EFFECT SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SOUTHERN ERIE...ORLEANS...GENESEE...NIAGARA...AND NORTHERN ERIE COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy lake effect snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This band of heavy snow is producing snow at the rate of one to 2 inches per hour. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 634 PM EST, a band of heavy lake snow extend across Grand Island, far southern Niagara and into Orleans county on the northern end, and from the City of Buffalo east to Clarence and over to Batavia on the southern end. This band will slowly expand and shift south towards the Buffalo Southtowns to include Lackawanna, West Seneca, Alden, and then Hamburg, Orchard Park, and East Aurora this evening. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Lackawanna, Batavia, Kenmore, Depew, Tonawanda, Amherst, Lancaster, Williamsville, Darien Lakes State Park, Grand Island, Elma, Marilla, Le Roy, Pembroke, and Akron. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 48 and 56. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&
